SENT.plain: A patient with typical congenital contractural arachnodactyly followed up from the age of 12 years to the age of 48 is reported
He had spiderlike fingers and toes and marked contractures of the knees, ankles, toes, shoulders, elbows and fingers; the mobility of the hips and wrists was almost normal
Persistent knee contractures prevented him from walking
In his twenties he had an osteotomy of both femora and shortening of the patellar tendons which enabled him to walk for the first time in an upright position without external support
When seen at the age of 48 the range of movement of his knees was 0 to 90 degrees
He was working as a turner and had been doing so for almost 20 years
